website_summaries.verdict: This large manual coffee grinder is easy to use and adjust to your desired coffee texture.
pros: Stores enough ground coffee for 3 cups
Reduces beans to a fine powder quickly
cons: A few users have complained that the grind is inconsistent

website_summaries.verdict: Don’t disturb coworkers with a noisy electric grinder. This model is cost-effective enough to grind fresh beans both at home and at the office.
pros: No static buildup, so grounds don't stick to burrs or hopper
doesn't take up much storage space
Only needs a few minutes to grind enough coffee for 2-4 cups to desired consistency
Also works great for grinding spices
cons: Unlike more expensive models, this one doesn't screw onto a Mason jar
Burrs need regular cleaning for consistent results

customer_reviews.title: Forget shakeweights, buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Easily adjusted to any grind, disassembles easily. Can’t fault the product too much for the laws of mechanics, but I did find a way to improve the design a touch.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect grounds - fine or coarse
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, fits nicely in my hand while I turn the handle to grind the beans. This thing can make VERY FINE grounds which I discovered after using it the first time :-) Backing off a couple of clicks makes perfect grounds for my Aeropress. I also really like making coarse ground for the french press because I don't end up with a lot of sediment like a blade grinder. And no static cling - the grounds fall right out of the glass jar.
customer_reviews.author: ASF

customer_reviews.title: Wastes a lot of coffee to get an inconsistent grind.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what is going on, it seems everybody loves this grinder. I wasted a lot of coffee to get a grind that would not choke my espresso machine. When I finally got a grind that would work, I found the grind to be inconsistent. And recreating the grind with the less than accurate click setup is ridiculous. If you like espresso, save yourself the trouble and use something else. I am going back to my Cuisinart burr grinder and returning this.. I contacted the seller, but received no response.
customer_reviews.author: David Achilli

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder... until it wasn't
customer_reviews.text: This was consistent, giving me exactly the size of grounds I wanted for about two years. This morning it broke. There are plastic pieces that secure the cone grinder in its place. These go up inside the cone, so that when you twist the handle, it twists the cone. It's a high torque/stress piece, and it's made of plastic. That plastic broke, and now the entire grinder is broken. Up until then, for two years it helped me make excellent coffee, but it's just not durable.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart during grind!!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to use and I like that I can see the grind in the bottle Cons: Difficult to set the grind for french press because there are no discernible “clicks” but the worst thing is the whole grinding assembly has fallen out two times out of the five times I’ve used it! Both times I had about a tablespoon of beans fall into the bottle along with the round burr, spring and grind setter (the piece you turn to set the grind and holds the whole assembly together)!! I thought I must need to tighten it a little but then the grinds aren’t coarse enough! I guess you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Sherrodd

customer_reviews.title: This makes a very fine powder, like when you buy ground spices
customer_reviews.text: This makes a very fine powder, like when you buy ground spices. I use this for spices since I have an electric burr grinder for my espresso. Actually, i make this an electric burr grinder for my spices by using a power screwdriver instead of the hand wrench. Don’t run it too fast though, I’m not sure how much heat the burr can take before degrading. Spices are usually softer than coffee anyway, especially on second grind. I usually use a cheap blade grinder to coarse grind my spices, then the hand grinder with a power screwdriver to make fine powder. Just like they didn’t do in the old days! Mortar and pestle has nothing on this :)
customer_reviews.author: The Saddest Panda

customer_reviews.title: Cheap junk
customer_reviews.text: This was a waste of money for me. I have an electric the does the job in a few seconds. Thought a manual unit would be a relaxing way to get some fresh brew. This cheap plastic unit takes about 2 minutes of grinding away with an uncomfortable tiny handle to get enough coffee for a few cups. Given the cheap construction I doubt it would hold up to daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto Recardo

customer_reviews.title: Not 100% satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Had this for ten months now and the grind is not consistent at all. You get large chunks all the way down to fine espresso grind, and that all at the same time. I want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Parker

customer_reviews.title: I gotta quit buying cheap:
customer_reviews.text: I rarely read the comments on products but I wish I would have read about this item. The KONA Coffee Grinder from IDYLC Homes. Terrible purchase. Sometimes cheap things work, not in this case. I twisted the top right off the first grinding. I would return it but it is just to cheap, cheap to buy, cheap to make with very cheap parts.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore D. Manley

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is pretty much perfect for what I needed, a coarse grind for cold brew at home. It's quiet, relative to automatic grinders (another issue for me, since I have roommates.) It's good for the price. The coarseness adjustment foiled me at first, my husband pointed out the adjustment for that is on the bottom of the grinder, so you have to take the jar off the bottom to access that. The only slight downside I've found, is that the jar attaches to the bottom loosely, it seems like it could come apart easily. While in use it hasn't given me any issues yet, but it seems like it might which is worrisome.
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve

customer_reviews.title: I'm the only coffee drinker in the household and love drinking cold press
customer_reviews.text: I'm the only coffee drinker in the household and love drinking cold press, so this fit my needs perfectly! I wish there was better instructions/guidlines as to how to adjust the grinder to the desired coarseness. Pretty easy to assemble and I use my French Press constantly
customer_reviews.author: AltariaOP

customer_reviews.title: Grinds Flax Seeds
customer_reviews.text: I use it to grind flax seeds and it works great. Took me a few tries to get the adjustment right. I was going to return it at first, but thankfully I kept playing with it and got it to work. I keep the top filled with flax seeds and store it in the fridge. I just grind what I need and empty the jar each time. I love not having to make all that noise with an electric coffee grinder anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Book Worm

customer_reviews.title: I love this coffee grinder!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect little grinder for my morning cup of coffee. By the time my electric kettle is done I usually have my beans ground. It's very simple to use and the middle is very easy to hold onto while grinding. I love it! But if I had a lot of beans to grind for a large pot I'd probably get tired. However for just my large cup in the morning it is absolutely perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: Anita Flood

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I do this earlier?!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really easy tool to use to prepare freshly ground coffee. I am beginning to enjoy the three-minute ritual of grinding my own beans manually. In addition I make coffee very early in the morning and my electric coffee mill is quite loud. The Kona manual grinder allows me to prepare freshly ground coffee quietly without waking everybody else. I will also take it with me when traveling to ensure I get freshly ground coffee while away.
customer_reviews.author: J. Salasin

customer_reviews.title: It's exactly what you think it is.
customer_reviews.text: Love the price, and knew it wouldn't be the best hand grinder out there, but it performs well enough to make a single cup of coffee at a time. The glass bottom is a great touch, though the plastic top feels fine, but not sturdy. Not positive my time/hands/desire to grind mutiple cups at a time is all that high, but we'll see. I'm interested to see how long the burrs hold up--at this price, once they falter, it's on to a new grinder, but for now, I'm happy I got this.
customer_reviews.author: Noel

customer_reviews.title: Does the job for its price, but inconsistent grind.
customer_reviews.text: It does the job and grinds beans (with some effort and noise), but the main reason I was looking for a conical burr grinder was because I heard they have more consistent grind sizes. This was not true for this manual grinder. If you're really into coffee, I suggest just shelling out the $100 or so for a nice automatic grinder. If you're not, this is a great product for its price.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffees
customer_reviews.text: I have a single cup manual drain coffee maker. Thought this whole time it doesn’t work well because the coffee always comes out very water down and weak. I would usually use it with an electric grinder. But after it broke I almost gave it up and got myself a small coffee maker. But I used this grinder and it made one of the best coffees I’ve ever tasted. Full flavor and the aroma was phenomenal! It just takes time to grind up the coffee. But hey what you have to pay for good coffee.
customer_reviews.author: She N

customer_reviews.title: Nice hand crank grinder
customer_reviews.text: Nice hand crank grinder, mine came with certificate for free extra ceramic burr...The crank / handle mechanism looks well built..I set adjustment to finest grind for Greek / Turkish coffee and it produced a fine powder like it should have..You need one heaping teaspoon of coffee powder for each demi-tasse cup..It took me 30 minutes to achieve 2 heaping teaspoons , hence 4 stars instead of 5... If I had enough money to buy a ZARA grinder from Greece I would , but I don't so the KONA will have to do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than Stainless Steel
customer_reviews.text: Overall, very satisfied. Time will tell the durability of the spring that holds the ceramic burr, and the attachment screws. But so far its performing as intended. Additionally the glass chamber makes it easier to see the grit size for quick adjust of the burr, which the Stainless Steel case models cannot do. Update: Hand crank does make the results inconsistent
customer_reviews.author: JesSam

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the package I see that the plastic piece is cracked. Please send replacement product and I will update my rating accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Amazing price and amazing grinder!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works GREAT! Grinds beans into fine powder so fast and easy, it's actually fun to use. Now I can bring my Moka pot and KONA grinder camping and have some real coffee in the morning. I wanted a conical Burr grinder for my new espresso machine but didn't have the 100$+ for one of the automatic ones, so glad I found this thing. Espresso made with my auto steel blade grinder vs. the KONA is a totally different experience, the flavor you get with property ground beans is astounding.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler R. Doering

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful addition to the French Press
customer_reviews.text: I like this product to grind that perfect bean for my French Press. It is easy to use and clean, though I use it for coffee only, so I don't really clean it. I keep it in a cabinet and it doesn't really get dirty. Grinds easily. Seems durable or well made. Just got it for Christmas, so I have only used it twice; once in the morning and again for after dinner coffee. The company is really responsive to customer satisfaction. Highly recommend this company and product.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine W.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect choice!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use and to clean. This is the first time I've ground beans for coffee, and it really is so worth the few minutes it takes! Delicious coffee, whether cold brewed or drip. No loud noise, no need for electricity. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I manually ground the beans for literally 30 minutes and only produced about a tablespoon of coffee. It almost seemed like the blades weren’t sharp. Great for burning calories but bad for making coffee!
customer_reviews.author: MaryW

customer_reviews.title: Perfect manual coffee grinder to make individual coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Works as described...I simply experimented to find the correct grind for my drip coffee maker. It takes me ~3 minutes to grind for .5 liter of coffee....2 cups. I find myself grinding the night before or in the morning depending on my schedule. The grinder arrived in working order and adjusting the grind only took 2 table spoons. I use a vintage drip coffee maker and this works perfectly. The glass container will hold enough coffee for a solid 6 cups. I am very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dortch

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a different grind
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a burr grinder that would allow me to do coarse grinds for cold brew. This little gem holds exactly 2 oz of beans, which is the correct amount for 16oz of water. It was easy to set the grind, after I read the instructions left by another. All you do is turn the little white disc at the bottom to unwind it.
customer_reviews.author: Mac Maven

customer_reviews.title: Methodical coffee making.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little coffee mill. It is small and portable and makes a very fine grind. My coffee is noticeably better than when I used an electric grinder. Perfect for my French press. It takes a little longer to grind the beans with this mill, but well worth the wait. It adds another level of ritual to the coffee making experience.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Reader

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase on Amazon so far!
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is amazing....I set it to 16 clicks and the grind is perfect for french press and pour over style coffee. Its really easy to use and clean. I will buy another in a bigger size as I use this one in my office and now i want one for home. It disassembles easy for travel too! No electricity needed just pack your fav beans, your Kona grinder and a french press and your set with some amazing coffee no matter where u are. The customer service from this company was excelent and I even got a free extra burr grinder!
customer_reviews.author: andrea

customer_reviews.title: Grinds coffee fine - that's about it
customer_reviews.text: Grinds coffee fine - that's about it. Took this apart one time to rinse out the top half for a new batch of coffee. When I say took it apart, I mean I loosened it up and rinsed it out, not even actually removing the burr. It no longer sits flush against the glass container so my grounds fall out when I take it off. It doesn't have any more clicking feedback on the adjustments so you know how fine your grind is. Just a waste of my time. I'll be buying a different grinder today. This one made it about 2 weeks. And I only use it 2-4x weekly.
customer_reviews.author: Darren K.

customer_reviews.title: No beans left unground.
customer_reviews.text: Easy filling compartment for beans, easy adjustment that stays put, easy to clean. So much nicer grind than my electric blade grinder, no whole beans or chunks left. I like knowing that the great coffee beans I found will now get the best grind for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: Coyote

customer_reviews.title: Coffee grinder does not work after 1 use
customer_reviews.text: After I used it once and took it apart to clean, I am now not able to get it to work (grind coffee beans) again when I put it back together. I tried multiple times without any success. I did follow the diagram that was included in packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Grey Raven

customer_reviews.title: Good functionality for the price
customer_reviews.text: ***updated review** I had originally given 2 stars because the inner grinding burr was very off center (yielding coffee grounds that were half fine powder and half sizable chunks, however, Idylc Homes had very prompt and friendly customer service and sent me a replacement. So: I've had it for about five months now and use it most mornings (4-5 days a week). Here are my thoughts: Pros: looks nice, works easily, gets the job done, good functionality, takes up little space Cons: The replacement sent still has a burr slightly off-center (about a millimeter). Not enough to really bother me, but thought I'd mention this in case someone out there is fanatical about their coffee grounds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this grinder
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this grinder. I received an email from manufacturer before item arrived with more detailed instructions which was very helpful. I set grinder to suggested setting for French press and haven't had to make any adjustments. This grinder works even better than my electric. I chose this to use for camping and such and have resorted to using even at home. It's perfect for early morning coffee making, allowing me to grind in a much quite manner. I only have to fill the hopper once to produce the perfect amount for my French press. Very convenient even with the added time it takes to grind manually which is maybe an entire minute.
customer_reviews.author: Kerb

customer_reviews.title: Decent hand grinder option.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for occasional use in a French press, and it has been satisfactory thus far. As others have noted with hand grinders, it's not the quickest way to get there, but I normally have enough ground for a liter of strong coffee before the water boils. Nice to have an analog option as electric grinders make such a hellacious noise.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Product was defective, customer service helped
customer_reviews.text: I received the grinder and immediately noticed that the piece that holds the burr is not matched to the piece surrounding it, so at all grind settings, very coarse pieces come through, with doesnt allow for consistency at all. Update: I contacted the company, and they assured me my grinder was defective. They were very kind and sent me a new one, which works much better. I have only been using it for about a week, but it has held up pretty well. I usually use it for espresso, and it does a decent job for the price. My pour overs turned out pretty good too. Although, the grinder does make a screeching noise, which does concern me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a couple years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in February 2018 and the internal burr just broke (ie. split in half) today (May 2020). You can find replacement burrs for about $8 on here: replacing one less-than-ten-dollar part every couple years is probably an acceptable tradeoff for most people. It's also not the easiest to clean: you have to unscrew and disassemble a lot of small parts, and if you grind up something other than coffee, you might find that stuff will stick to the jar for the rest of its life. Other than that, this has been a pretty nice coffee grinder. It's especially nice for the Aeropress: the jar with the grounds tapers into the tube very neatly.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart P. Bentley

customer_reviews.title: A very neat little coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: A very neat little coffee grinder. I actualy appreciate the size -- it's quite compact, but still provides enough storage to make coffee for 2-4 persons at once, great for backpacking, etc. I haven't had a chance to experiment with many differents grind settings, but the setting I used provided a very fine and consistent "output", definitely better than my electric grinder. I really like the fact that the burr is all ceramic, and this is one of the reasons I chose this particular one. Not sure how long it's going to last though, so we'll see...
customer_reviews.author: AmazeOn

customer_reviews.title: Intuitive, compact, effective
customer_reviews.text: I used this to coarsely grind coffee for cold brew. It worked well and gives you great control of the grind. The receptacle on the bottom is great for transferring the grinds without mess. It did take a lot of elbow grease to get through grinding all the coffee required to make cold brew. But, that probably won't be an issue if your just using it to make a cup or two at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Hand Grinder
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is a perfect companion for my Aeropress. I only make enough for a small amount up to twice a day, and this grinder works great with my overall flow of preparation. I can grind about 1 [aeropress] scoop of beans in the amount of time it takes my electric kettle to heat up. My only complaint is that the angle of the glass can sometimes cause grinds to get stuck inside and it can take a bit of tapping to clear.
customer_reviews.author: David H

customer_reviews.title: Would have been nice to get instructions leading to starting settings for fine
customer_reviews.text: My first shot made a decent cup of French press coffee. Would have been nice to get instructions leading to starting settings for fine, medium, and course grind without having to grind multiple batches to see how they come out.
customer_reviews.author: Photofan

customer_reviews.title: The finest setting is powder fine making for a great cup ...
customer_reviews.text: The finest setting is powder fine making for a great cup of pour over coffee, and there is a course setting that works wonderfully for cold brew. That says to me it's also going work nicely for espresso and pressed. Grinding out the fine takes awhile, but it makes for a pleasant and short forearm workout resulting in very tasty cuppa' Gripping this grinder is also a lot firmer and more comfortable than my previous metal tube grinder. I'm giving it a 4 rather than a 5 only because I can't yet vouch for its long term reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Steverino

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this grinder. I've always been using an electric grinder but the consistency this gets is so much more superior. I also feel like I use my beans more sparingly because I can visualize exactly how much is ground. I've been using this along with an aeropress and get a really good cup of coffee every time. It also travels well, I've taken it camping and on business travel - it packs well. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Miller

customer_reviews.title: A little arm workout.
customer_reviews.text: It takes time to get the hang of grinding one's own beans. I make a full French press and it takes me about 2 minutes to grind all the beans (down from about twice that when I first got the grinder a couple weeks ago). I like the even grind that I get, and my coffee does have a nice, smooth taste.
customer_reviews.author: L. Em.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Grinder! - Read and follow the Instructions
customer_reviews.text: Nice Grinder! - Well Made - The parts that make up the whole are top flight stainless metal - ceramic burr - glass and even the plastic parts are the kind that don't stink of petrol-chemicals - like I said - Nice! - - - it's a personal device in that it's something you can do for yourself that's special - all a part of that morning coffee ritual - recommended! ~;0)
customer_reviews.author: Chas

customer_reviews.title: Nice coffee bean grinder
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice manual coffee grinder. I find it is easy to use and I am able to get the ground I need for my French press. I do not feel it takes a lot of effort and actually enjoy grinding the beans while waiting for the water to get hot. Great for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Bowz

customer_reviews.title: Good build; slow grinding
customer_reviews.text: It's very well built, it feels sturdy. However, it kind of takes a while to grind, prepare to spend a while. I got a manual grinder because I have roommates and didn't want to wake them up with the electric motor. This hand held grinder still makes a decent amount of noise (and for longer periods of time) than an electric, so something to consider! Gave it 4 stars cause it does exactly what it is suppose to do, just not as efficiently as it could and because I enjoyed the design.
customer_reviews.author: Luc

customer_reviews.title: Just works
customer_reviews.text: Simple effective design, coarse/fine adjustment is a simple knob underneath that sets the gap between the two grinding surfaces, low effort to crank. (Grinding coffee in the morning by hand is kind of cathartic for some reason). Principally use to grind coffee for French Press. Have to say, it does actually make a difference to grind with this vs the blade type electric I used before. Well worth the money spent..
customer_reviews.author: oscardad

customer_reviews.title: Use for coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: Grinding my coffee beans in this is all I need to jump-start my arm workout. The parts that actually grind are made of ceramic; it's easy to adjust and the setting does not get loosened no matter how much I use it. If you don't want a negligible morning arm workout, I suggest you get an electric grinder. Either way, you'll wake up the whole house--this one is at least portable and you can take it outside.
customer_reviews.author: Gus

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive manual grinder
customer_reviews.text: I use this exclusively for grinding coffee beans. It works great, it's consistent, and it's easy to use. It takes some time for a full cleaning of the grinder, as you have to let it dry completely before using it again, but that's a minor annoyance. Great grinder for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Mar-Vell Jones

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for course grinding for cold brew
customer_reviews.text: Adjusting to as course as possible, this burr grinder is perfect for cold brew. It does take awhile and I have to fill it full of beans 3 times to get enough grounds for one 40oz carafe fill. But the consistency is perfect and after over a month of use making 3-4 batches per week I'm now confident that this grinder will hold up and be useful for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Happy Customer
customer_reviews.text: I had a cheap coffee grinder that made such an uneven grind for my cold brew. I couldn’t afford an electric so gave this a try. It’s a little work but really doesn’t take any longer than my old cheap thing. My coffee is a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Dandy Little Coffee Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this two months ago and use it once every two weeks. That gives me enough grounds for a cup a day. Although it requires some effort to grind the coffee manually, it's easy enough to use, and the price is reasonable. In event of a power failure, I can make cold coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: ... time and was unsure which would suit my needs best. When I came across this kona grinder the ...
customer_reviews.text: I has been looking into buying burr grinder for some time and was unsure which would suit my needs best. When I came across this kona grinder the first thing that stood out was how much cheaper it was than all most all the rest and it still had great reviews. I bought it for the cost figuring it couldn't be the worst thing. Turns out I have no real complaints, it grinds my coffee beans as coarse as I want and finer than I need, super easy to adjust. It is easy to take apart to clean and easy to reassemble, takes no time at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everything is perfect but the handle.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this grinder for my coffee each morning. The system is easy to take apart and clean (use a decent abrasive) and the grind settings are simple enough to adjust. I also love the ceramic grinders. That was a huge reason I bought this grinder was for their longevity. They can take a beating and hold their form just fine. The only complaint I have is with the handle. The metal is softer and has started to torque with my daily uses. If I could get a replacement I would love that, but i’ll probably have to buy a new grinder.
customer_reviews.author: studwick

customer_reviews.title: Really nice and "fun" little grinder!
customer_reviews.text: I was using the "skinny" stainless type of hand grinder which functions well BUT takes too firm a grip to operate. So I bought this because it is "fat" and much easier to hold firmly while grinding. Mine had a little chunk(chip) in the cone(male) part of the ceramic grind mechanism. So I took a picture and emailed it to Idylc Homes. They responded right away telling me a replacement was on the way. By the way even though I had told them that replacing just the chipped part would be great they replaced the whole thing. Kudos Idylc Homes!! It is so much easier to use than 'Ol Skinny. Thanks Guys
customer_reviews.author: S. Withey

customer_reviews.title: Love this grinder
customer_reviews.text: Love this grinder. I've only had for a few weeks, but I'm enjoying it. Of course, I'm used to high quality burr grinders, but this works flawlessly for my office (grinder would be too loud and disruptive). Thank you, Jason Decena for checking in on my product experience!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: but this is working great so far
customer_reviews.text: I am not a manual coffee grinder expert, but this is working great so far! It is only big enough for one person, but it is perfect for tiny kitchens!
customer_reviews.author: inquisitiveone

customer_reviews.title: Good Coffee Grinder
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well. It adjusts to a very coarse grind which we need in order to cold brew. It was a challenge to clean it and get back together, but should be easier next time. After a four or five uses it works pretty well. We used to have an electric coffee grinder that made a huge mess, this seems much nicer in that way.
customer_reviews.author: Jim S

customer_reviews.title: Great grinds
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for small quantities of freshly ground coffee, e.g. for a stovetop Italian espresso pot. It also does a great job on whole spices. It takes a good bit of elbow grease so for large quantities or users with hand or arm limitations, I’d recommend an electric grinder.
customer_reviews.author: E. Carmichael

customer_reviews.title: Great for price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it’d be hard to beat this grinder. I have this is my office and grind the beans for my French press in the morning. I shut my office door while I do it because it’s not exactly quiet (but not crazy loud). Its wonderful to have freshly ground beans daily though. Negatives: you have to take it apart to clean and then you lose your grind setting; you have to guess on the settings - the coarseness/fineness of the grind is based on how tightly you screw in the bottom portion.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, consistent grinder
customer_reviews.text: I've used this grinder every day for over a year now and it's still going strong. Once you dial in the grind size that you want, just load up the beans and go to work. I like to place a silicon trivet under the grinder to keep it from slipping since my counter top is really smooth. The company did provide a coupon for a free replacement set of ceramic grinding stones, but I have yet to need them. Overall, a very good experience with the company and the product.
customer_reviews.author: MarkM

customer_reviews.title: Good for a single mug of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate the small size and the variable grinds available. I did note that the clicks to determine the courser grinds were not as distinct as the clicks for the finer grinds. It took a few mornings to determine the proper grind. While it does take a bit longer to hand grind my beans it is not that much longer. All in all I am very pleased with the grinder. My electric grinder will become a spice grinder.
customer_reviews.author: an older student

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome grinder. The volume is also larger than similar products(4-5 k cups). It takes 5 mins to grind Kona peaberry to fine so it should handle other beans even faster. Only thing I worried about is the handle and bolt does not fit very tight therefore it will show some wear after time.
customer_reviews.author: Xuan Zhang

customer_reviews.title: This results in a grind with fine and coarse parts and it's very difficult to make ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice little grinder, produces consistent grade. Make sure assembled properly, otherwise the grade adjustment nut would get lose while grinding resulting in inconsistent grind. The top plastic piece that holds the beans in the top part came with a chip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great coffee grinder for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great coffee grinder for the price. I wish the handle were smaller because grinding can be tedious, but it produces a more consistent grind than the Hamilton electric grinder I have. I was surprised at how much better the coffee tasted when I used the KONA grinder. The burrs are adjustable, so you can set it on a coarser grind for french press or cold brew too.
customer_reviews.author: anonymoz

customer_reviews.title: Easy grind.
customer_reviews.text: I found this convenient and easy to fine grind. The glass bottom helps you know what is ground out. The crank works smoothly for the aged wrist. You can adjust fineness of grind easily. Adding beans does not demand much adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Madame

customer_reviews.title: Might be good for coffee beans but iffy for seeds and spices
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for spices and seeds not coffee as I use a Keurig, but though it says "spice, herb, pepper" here I can't get it to grind flax seeds; it either drops them through whole or doesn't put anything through; I'm hoping I can still figure out the right setting; otherwise it is simple to assemble and use.
customer_reviews.author: Bob A.

customer_reviews.title: Will be great for our Camp Trailer
customer_reviews.text: Tried it out right away. Adjustment seems to work great. Tried for expresso (fine) and corse for percalator. I bought for our camp trailer and use perc then. Grinding takes a few minutes, but not too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: which I love, and works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I gave it a one star rating when I received the product, because the grinder wasn't new. Idylc Homes' customer service became aware of the issue and sent me a brand new grinder, which I love, and works as advertised. I get the necessary amount of coffee to brew 3 cups in about 5-10 minutes. Excellent QPR!
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Superb Grinder
customer_reviews.text: This model is superb in my opinion for grinding coffee beans. Easy to adjust grind for fine to course. The instructions are clear and concise to establish ease of use. I'm very pleased with choosing this coffee grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but is great as a shoulder/arm exercises and works really well
customer_reviews.text: takes for freaking ever to grind the coffee, but is great as a shoulder/arm exercises and works really well. if you remove it to clean it, beware of how the spring fits in, as the instructions don't cover this. I can't nock the price for any reason, including my own laziness. it is a manual grinder, I knew what I was getting. sheesh
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough
customer_reviews.text: It's durable and fairly easy to grind with, although you'll definitely feel it by the time you're done. My only problem lies with the plastic cap over the top of the beans. When I'm grinding it often pops loose, and if I'm not paying attention, beans end up on the floor. There needs to be done sort of locking mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: don

customer_reviews.title: I like the adjustable aspect of the design
customer_reviews.text: I like the adjustable aspect of the design. I used it to set the granularity that was ideal for my french press. I accidentally dropped the glass collector from about 1m above the ground and it did **NOT** break. That's impressive! I would definitely buy again in case I really break it ;)
customer_reviews.author: MHM

customer_reviews.title: Takes patience but makes great coffee
customer_reviews.text: I really like the taste of coffee ground in this thing, the same beans taste better from this than from an electric steel-bladed grinder, and I get a more uniform grind. My only issue is with how long it takes, but I can live with that when I'm just wanting to enjoy a nice cup.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce

customer_reviews.title: Happy I bought this little manual hand grinder
customer_reviews.text: Not only does this grind coffee beans, but it grinds my cacao nibs into cacao powder. Happy I bought this little manual hand grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie

customer_reviews.title: Useful as a spice grinder
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't take the time to grind coffee for 2 every morning with this thing, but it works for smaller quantities, such as the occasional single cup french press, or spices.
customer_reviews.author: W. Heublein

customer_reviews.title: Wife an I love this. Makes great grinds and great coffee
customer_reviews.text: Wife an I love this. Makes great grinds and great coffee. It's also really fast if you're making a single cup. Nothing beats fresh ground!
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii Guy

customer_reviews.title: Have a bag of your preferred grind nearby.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great grinder for the price and performs fairly well. I had a bit of trouble getting the grind setting i wanted, so much so that i had to get a bag of pre ground coffee and check sizes side-by-side. after that, i havent had to change the grinder in the slightest. Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: The Noels

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Really like it. Makes nice fine ground coffee. Takes me about a minute or so to grind for one big morning cup. I then use a pour-over single-serve dripper - works great! I think t's made of ceramic, glass bottom, plastic top, and stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: motoko hunting

customer_reviews.title: Basic and enjoyable ...low tech ...perfect 👍🌴
customer_reviews.text: I like this product because you can adjust the grind size to your preference, and experiment with different types of beans, grinds and custom blend my own special cup of "Joe", mahalo 🌴👍
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish crank handle knob!
customer_reviews.text: The crank handle on this had the plastic knob pull out after the first month I used it. I have tried fixing it 10 times now and it’s just rubbish. I will be buying a better quality one for a few more bucks next time.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Carlin

customer_reviews.title: a little squeaky (not bad) - consistent grinds
customer_reviews.text: Have used this 2x a week for four months and it's held up pretty well. It's gotten a little squeaky (like birds chirping every few turns of the crank), but the grinds appear consistent.
customer_reviews.author: I. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to grind up nuts. It doesn't. They just sit in the hopper while I spin the handle. I don't see how it could possibly grind coffee beans. I took some mixed nuts and put them in a baggie and beat them with a mallet, then I put them into the grinder. Still no luck. Don't waste your money. This is going in the trash. Guess I'll stick with the meat mallet !
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E Abbott,Sr

customer_reviews.title: Needed some thing to grind brown rice fro Sake
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to course grind raw brown rice to make Sake. After trying many other things, blenders, food processors, nut grinder, rolling pin, mortar and pestle, ... I found this coffee grinder and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Guy

customer_reviews.title: Fresh
customer_reviews.text: Takes a while to grind but you know your consistently getting good grounds. And you knew what you signed up for with a manual grinder. Makes a small amount but is perfect for one or two cups in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: peter

customer_reviews.title: Great compact grinder
customer_reviews.text: The grinder just came in the mail. I promptly took it out and started to grind my beans for an espresso. It was slow going since the grind is very fine, but the cup of coffee was terrific. I can certainly tell the difference between a burr grinder and an blade grinder. This grinder is compact with a removeable handle (great for our camping trips) and I especially like that the bottom part is glass. Can't wait to use my grinder for my morning joe.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew P Schneyer

customer_reviews.title: Fresh ground coffee
customer_reviews.text: OMG! This is absolutely wonderful. It's manual powered but. I live in Maine & wanted to be able to use it with power failure. Freshly ground coffee is a special treat. Now I shop for whole bean coffee. Thank you & thank you for teaming up with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Strictlin

customer_reviews.title: I think this is a good product, but not sure it's really meant for ...
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a good product, but not sure it's really meant for everyday use. I've had mine for a couple of months now and it's just kinda hard to get a consistent, even grind each time. The handle feels kind of awkward when turning and I have occasionally hurt myself with it. Not crazy about it, but I'll keep it for now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The coffee is perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Fluted top piece makes it much easier to hold than other grinders. The coffee is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Nored

customer_reviews.title: This performs well and with ease -a welcomed enhancement to ...
customer_reviews.text: This performs well and with ease -a welcomed enhancement to my daily ritual. I had found a ground coffee that was decent enough for my re-useable Kurig pod filter but wondered if fresh ground coffee would make a noticeable difference -it does. I meant to use the Kona grinder occasionally as a treat but I use it every day as a treat.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ketcham

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder for spices
customer_reviews.text: I bought this burr grinder for whole spices and we just tried some Fennel and it ground through it quickly and cracked the fennel the way I wanted. I will be getting lots of use out of it for grinding spices to be used in sausage and rubs. I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this grinder
customer_reviews.text: Happy about the price, but love that I can adjust the grind level without breaking the bank on a grinder. If I have to get another, I will get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An inexpensive coffee grinder that makes smooth, delicious coffee.
customer_reviews.text: "This manual coffee grinder makes delicious coffee. I was skeptical that using a burr grinder would make much of a difference in the taste of the coffee. Coffee has a much smoother and less acidic taste. It takes about 4 minutes to hand grind the beans but it the grinding process became a part of my morning routine and well worth the time. I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Madeline

customer_reviews.title: Coffee workout
customer_reviews.text: If you want to work real hard for a cup of coffee in the morning then please by all means purchase. Very slow. Hard to find a good grind for french press after reading directions. My water came up to a boil in a full kettle of water before I had enough ground coffee to two measly cups. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: eric rustic

customer_reviews.title: KONA manual coffeegrinder
customer_reviews.text: i use it for espresso coffee only,has better taste,then with the electric blades. Maybe it is the heat a electric blade generates! The same happens meat/sandwich slices, the heat of the electric blades do change the taste of the meat,it has been quoted by professional meat cutters.special for very expensive meats.
customer_reviews.author: Edith

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. I only do coarse grind for my cold brew so it goes pretty quick.
customer_reviews.author: Hans T

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Grind Flax Seeds
customer_reviews.text: I got this to grind flax seeds for my oatmeal and it doesn't grind them. They are too small for it to grind and it wasn't easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: playground rat mom

customer_reviews.title: Easy!
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is easy to use and does a great job! Very happy with it! Only problem, the directions and care instructions were in very small print. Hard for old eyes to read!
customer_reviews.author: Vickie A.

customer_reviews.title: Mine didn't allow setting steady grinds
customer_reviews.text: The device does grind coffee consistenlu but mine didn't allow the grind level to be set in increments -- whatever was supposed to hold the grind levels (clicks) was missing causing a smooth clickless feedback when twisting the grind nut. I had to return mine as a result.
customer_reviews.author: Santhosh V

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: This thing does the job. I use it every morning to grind beans for my one cup of coffee. I use a pour over method and it turns out great. I grind while waiting for the water to heat up. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: Bianca ReaganTop Contributor: Pets

product_meta.title: KONA Manual Coffee Grinder, Conical Burr Mill with Adjustable Setting, Best Ceramic Burr Coffee Grinder for Aeropress, Drip Coffee, Espresso, French Press, Turkish Brew
product_meta.description:
Here is a coffee grinder that is helping coffee lovers discover the full potential flavor of their favorite coffee bean

The secret to a great tasting cup of coffee is produced from whole beans that is handground within a few minutes of brewing


Smart Baristas know the foundation of a great cup of java starts with a reliable coffee grinder that produces consistent coffee grounds

A poor handle crank design made of soft metal components will likely lead to inconsistent coffee grounds or worst mechanical failure with only typical everyday use

More so, containers constructed with cheap flimsy plastic are destine to crack and frost-over. So we chose to pair our ceramic burrs with a clear thick glass container ensuring taste free parts so nothing comes between you and your fresh ground coffee

The Kona Coffee Mill Grinder features a lightweight and portable design inspired by top Baristas from around the world that demand durability and style. Its portable nature and sleek design is perfect for any home, work, or travel environments

Our high quality components ensures consistent uniform coffee grounds in every single brew. These smallkitchen handheld tools have been thoughtfully redesigned with a studier and easy-to-use hand crank


With these enhancements you will enjoy:

* Improved torque with less effort

* Stabilized Bur Mechanism

* Minimized mechanical failure


Idylc Homes prides in using the best quality parts available in designing our products. Our quality care starts from packaging in the factory all the way to your front door & beyond.

Discover the hidden flavors in your coffee beans RIGHT NOW. Why wait? Simply scroll up and ORDER NOW with confidence to start brewing your perfect mug TODAY!
feature_bullets: PREPARE INCREDIBLE COFFEE EVERY TIME ~ Built-in Stabilizer and adjustable coarse to fine grind selector with over 18 click settings ensures you have 100% precision control over the coarseness of your Pour Over, Drip, Chemex, Cold Brew, French Press, Percolator, AeroPress, Turkish, Espresso, Keurig K Cup, Herb, or Spice grind.
NO MORE GUESSING ~ see your results instantly after each grind rotation thanks to the static free & crystal clear glass jar which is able to store up to 50 grams of ground beans for 3 cups of coffee

BRING YOUR COFFEE ANYWHERE ~ No batteries, power, or long plastic cords needed to operate your portable compact coffee grinder, allowing you to travel with and brew freshly roasted ground coffee beans for two on your next camping, hiking, backpacking, or outdoor trips. Ergonomically designed manual crank handle detaches from grinder for compact storage
QUIET BY DESIGN ~ eliminates over 90% of the obnoxious noise that large electric grinders produce.

😍 What Our Amazon Customers Say: "Holy cow is this grinder awesome!" "The only slim coffee grinder for my home!" "Just purchased 3 more for family and friends" "Earns its 5 star ratings and reviews with ease!" "One of the best deals for any coffee lover" "Perfect coffee is back in my life!" 100% Money-Back Guarantee. Order today while supplies last.
